Trade/Device Name(s): CDC Human Influenza Virus Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel
CDC Human Influenza Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel
Submitter Information: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Regulation Name(s): Respiratory viral panel multiplex nucleic acid assay
Reagents for detection of specific novel influenza A viruses
Instrumentation for clinical multiplex test systems
Analyte(s): Influenza A subtypes (seasonal A/H1, A/H3, A/H1pdm09, A/H5)
Genetic lineages of influenza B (B/Victoria, B/Yamagata)
Specimen Container(s): Virus transport medium containing human A549 cells
Instrument(s)/Platform(s): Applied Biosystems (ABI) 7500 Fast Dx Real-Time PCR Instrument
Method(s)/Technology(ies): Oligonucleotide primers and dual-labeled hydrolysis (TaqMan) probes
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for CDC Human Influenza Virus Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel with added influenza B lineage genotyping capability for molecular detection and differentiation of human influenza viruses
Indications for Use Summary: Qualitative detection and differentiation of influenza virus type A or B, subtyping of influenza A, and genetic lineage determination of influenza B from viral RNA in upper and lower respiratory tract specimens, and viral culture, to support diagnosis, epidemiological surveillance, and presumptive identification of influenza A/H5 (Asian lineage) in conjunction with clinical and epidemiological information
